definitions.definition: A solid mass formed by the coalescence of separate particles; a compound substance, a concretion.
Specifically, a building material created by mixing cement, water, and aggregate such as gravel and sand.
definitions.example: The road was made of concrete that had been poured in large slabs.

definitions.definition: A term designating both a quality and the subject in which it exists; a concrete term.
Sugar boiled down from cane juice to a solid mass.
A dessert of frozen custard with various toppings.
An extract of herbal materials that has a semi-solid consistency, especially when such materials are partly aromatic.
(usually transitive) To cover with or encase in concrete (building material).
definitions.example: I hate grass, so I concreted over my lawn.

definitions.definition: (usually transitive) To solidify: to change from being abstract to being concrete (actual, real).
To unite or coalesce into a mass or a solid body.

definitions.example: Fuzzy videotapes and distorted sound recordings are not concrete evidence that bigfoot exists.

definitions.definition: Being or applying to actual things, not abstract qualities or categories.

definitions.example: While everyone else offered thoughts and prayers, she made a concrete proposal to help.

definitions.definition: United by coalescence of separate particles, or liquid, into one mass or solid.
(modifying a noun) Made of concrete, a building material.
definitions.example: The office building had concrete flower boxes out front.
